MSTP_TEST.desc: Configure MSTP globally with valid parameters.

MSTP_TEST_WRONG_MODE.desc: Configure an invalid STP mode in the MSTP configuration.
eStr: Invalid STP mode value. Valid values are 'mstp'.

MSTP_TEST_WRONG_INSTANCE.desc: Configure an invalid instance number in MSTP instance configuration.
eStr: Invalid MST instance number. Must be within the allowed range (0-4095).

MSTP_TEST_WRONG_PRIORITY.desc: Configure an invalid bridge priority value in MSTP.
eStr: Bridge priority must be a multiple of 4096.

MSTP_TEST_WITHOUT_NAME.desc: Configure MSTP region without a name (required).
eStr: MST Region name must be provided.

MSTP_TEST_MISSING_VLAN.desc: Configure an MSTP instance without specifying any VLANs.
eStr: At least one VLAN must be associated with the MSTP instance.

MSTP_TEST_INVALID_VLAN_LIST.desc: Configure an MSTP instance with an invalid VLAN list.
eStr: Invalid VLAN list format. Must be a comma-separated list of VLANs.

MSTP_TEST_MAX_HOPS_EXCEEDED.desc: Configure an MSTP instance with an invalid max hops value.
eStr: Max hops must be between 1 and 255.

MSTP_TEST_WRONG_HELLO_TIME.desc: Configure MSTP hello time outside the valid range.
eStr: Hello time must be between 1 and 10 seconds.

MSTP_TEST_INVALID_FORWARD_DELAY.desc: Configure MSTP forward delay outside the valid range.
eStr: Forward delay must be between 4 and 30 seconds.

MSTP_TEST_DUPLICATE_INSTANCE.desc: Configure an MSTP instance with a duplicate instance ID.

MSTP_TEST_GLOBAL_WITH_INVALID_MODE.desc: Configure MSTP global settings with an invalid mode.
